creator: sansoy
title: Leaf Skeletonization
materials_required: Sodium Carbonate (Arm & Hammer Super Washing Soda)
Fresh leaves (waxy appearance, like Magnolia leaves)
description: This project describes a method to skeletonize leaves by removing the flesh and leaving only the veins, similar to the natural decay process. The method involves using sodium carbonate to loosen the flesh, followed by careful brushing and optional bleaching for whitening. The finished leaves can be used for art or other decorative purposes.
steps: Prepare the sodium carbonate solution by mixing 1/2 cup of sodium carbonate with 2 cups of water in a metal pan.
Bring the solution to a boil on the stovetop, then reduce the heat to a simmer. Add the leaves to the simmering solution.
Simmer the leaves for 1-3 hours, replenishing water as it evaporates. Test for readiness by checking if the flesh is pulpy and starting to separate from the veins.
Once the leaves are ready, transfer them to a clear bowl with a thin layer of water.
Using tweezers to hold the stem, gently tap and brush the flesh away from the veins with a soft brush or toothbrush. Be very delicate to avoid damaging the veins. Repeat on both sides of the leaf.
Rinse the cleaned leaf carefully with water using a large spoon.
Optional: Soak the leaves in a small bowl of bleach for 20-30 minutes to whiten them.
Rinse the bleached leaves very carefully under cold water and transfer to napkins to dry. Pressing the leaves between two sets of napkins is recommended as they dry, so they will be flat.
